definition: to burn the midnight oil/to work late into the night

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
night
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
surname Che
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)

sentences.english: He sat up far into the night working on the report.
sentences.chinese: 他開夜車至深夜，寫那份報告。

sentences.english: He looks sleepy, maybe he stayed up late again yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 他看起來很疲倦，可能他昨天又開夜車了。

sentences.english: I'm behind in my work. I will have to stay up all night to meet the deadline.
sentences.chinese: 我的工作進度落後了，我得開夜車趕進度了。

sentences.english: It can't help you improve your grades soon to study late every night.
sentences.chinese: 天天開夜車學習並不能幫你快速提高學習成績。

sentences.english: If you stay up late working every night , your health will surely be affected.
sentences.chinese: 如果你每天開夜車工作，身體必然會受到影響。

sentences.english: If you work hard at other times you won't have to sit up all night before the exam.
sentences.chinese: 你要是平時努力學習，考前就不用整晚開夜車了。

sentences.english: Ever have a project deadline where you need to burn the midnight oil to get the work done?
sentences.chinese: 有沒有一個項目到了截止日期，你需要開夜車完成？

definition: viewing time
lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
see 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: lit. when the boat gets to the pier-head, it will go straight with the current (proverb)/fig. everything will be all right/cf 車到山前必有路，船到橋頭自然直|车到山前必有路，船到桥头自然直
pinyin: chuan2 dao4 qiao2 tou2 zi4 ran2 zhi2

definition: to visit relatives
(slang) to target an intoxicated person for sexual assault
lazybones/idle bum
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
to play truant/to cut classes
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
partner for dating/a date (boyfriend or girlfriend)
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
grand dreams/unrealistic ideas (idiom)
class meeting (in schools)
